document.masterDocTitle: Oribatid mites (Acari: Oribatida) recorded from Ireland: Catalogue, historical records, species habitats and geographical distribution, combinations, variations and synonyms

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Oribatid mites (Acari: Oribatida) recorded from Ireland: Catalogue, historical records, species habitats and geographical distribution, combinations, variations and synonyms

subSubSection.paragraph:
·
Dometorina plantivaga (Berlese, 1895)
*

· Original name:
Oribatula plantivaga Berlese, 1895
.

· In:
Acari, Myriapoda et Scorpiones
, 77(5).

· Synonyms:
Oppia tibialis sensu Berlese, 1892
non
Oribatula tibialis sensu Berlese, 1895
[misidentification]. Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : No habitat details provided (Halbert 1923). Counties: Dublin and Mayo .

·
Liebstadia humerata Sellnick, 1928

· Original name:
Liebstadia humerata Sellnick, 1928
.
· In: Formenkreis Hornmilben, Oribatei. In : P. Brohmer, Die Tierwelt Mitteleuropas , 3(4) 9, 1–42.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Liebstadia ( Liebstadia ) humerata (Sellnick) Subías, 2004
. Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Grass, moss, soil on cliff and agricultural soil (Bolger In press). Counties: Mayo .

·
Liebstadia similis (Michael, 1888)
*

· Original name:
Nostaspis similis Michael, 1888
.

· In: British
Oribatidae , Vols. I
and II. Ray Soc., London. 656 pp.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Eremaeus similis (Michael) Oudemans, 1900
;
Oribatula similis (Michael) Oudemans, 1906
;
Liebstadia ( Liebstadia ) similis (Michael) Subías, 2004
.

· Synonyms:
Oribates pallidula sensu Oudemans, 1896
non C.L. Koch, 1841 [misidentification];
Oribatula anomala Hull, 1916
;
Protoribates silesius Sellnick, 1925
;
Protoribates serratomarginatus Mahunka, 1983
. Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Moss and seashore habitats (under stones resting on peaty soils flooded at high tides and under stones on a grassy sward) and in old nests of sea birds, (Halbert 1915, 1920; Evans et al. 1961); agricultural grassland (Curry 1969, 1969b, 1970, 1971, 1973, 1976; Valarasan 1971; Ganley 1976; Curry and Tuohy 1978; Purvis 1978; Bolger 1980; Purvis and Curry 1980, 1981; Bolger and Curry 1984; Arroyo et al. 2015); cutaway raised bog and permanent pasture on peat (Whelan 1976); cutaway raised bog (Curry and Momen 1988); salt marsh (Healy 1975; Speight and Healy 1977); dune, pasture,
Iris bog
and gorse bank at seashore (Purvis 1982); soil in Sitka spruce and Monterey pine plots and in grasslands (unpublished data); pastures, broadleaved forests (birch), raised bogs, and blanket bogs (rough grazing) (Arroyo et al, 2009a); Machair fixed (stable), Machair fore dunes and Machair grassland (Arroyo and Bolger 2011); raised bogs, mountain blanket bogs, Atlantic blanket bogs and fens (Wisdom et al. 2011) riparian habitat (unpublished data); ant nests (Arroyo et al. 2015).

materialsCitation.location: Cork, Donegal, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, Limerick, Mayo, Offaly, Sligo and Wexford
materialsCitation.stateProvince: Cork, Donegal, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, Limerick, Mayo, Offaly, Sligo and Wexford

paragraph.materialsCitation: Counties: Cork, Donegal, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, Limerick, Mayo, Offaly, Sligo and Wexford .

subSubSection.paragraph:
·
Scheloribates ( Hemileius ) initialis
(Berlese, 1908)
*

· Original name:
Protoribates ( Scheloribates ) initialis Berlese, 1908
.

· In:
Redia
, 5, 2.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Oribatula ( Hemileius ) initialis (Berlese) Berlese, 1917
;
Hemileius initialis (Berlese) Grandjean, 1953
;
Hemileius ( Hemileius ) initialis (Berlese) Subías, 2004
.

· Synonyms:
Scheloribates confundatus Sellnick, 1928
;
Hemileius translamellatus Karpinen, 1974
[misidentification].

Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Agricultural grassland (Curry 1969, 1973, 1976, 1979); heather and shelter belt on peat (Longworth 1973); bog, grassland and permanent pasture on peat (both soil and herbage (Whelan 1978, 1985, 1986); corn crops, pastures, beech forests and blanket bogs (rough grazing) (Arroyo et al. 2009a); canopy of oak forest (Arroyo et al. 2013b); riparian habitat (unpublished data); ant nests (Arroyo et al. 2015).

materialsCitation.location: Carlow, Cork, Dublin Galway, Kerry, Kildare, Limerick, Mayo and Meath
materialsCitation.stateProvince: Carlow, Cork, Dublin Galway, Kerry, Kildare, Limerick, Mayo and Meath

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Counties:
Carlow, Cork, Dublin Galway , Kerry, Kildare, Limerick, Mayo and Meath
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
·
Scheloribates ( Scheloribates ) laevigatus
(C.L. Koch, 1835)
*

· Original name:
Zetes laevigatus C.L. Koch, 1835
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden , 3(8).

· Historical combinations/variations:
Scheloribates laevigatus (C.L. Koch) Sellnick, 1828
.

Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Under bark of a fir tree and on a green alga-like weed (Halbert 1907, 1915, 1920); agricultural grassland (Curry 1969, 1976; Valarasan 1971; Ganley 1976; Arroyo et al. 2015; unpublished data); salt marsh (Healy 1975; Speight and Healy 1977); cutaway raised bog and permanent pasture on peat (Whelan 1976); pastures and blanket bogs (rough grazing) (Arroyo et al. 2009a); Machair fixed (stable) dunes and Machair grassland (Arroyo and Bolger 2011); riparian habitat (unpublished data); ant nests (Arroyo et al. 2015).

materialsCitation.location: Donegal, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, Limerick, Mayo and Meath
materialsCitation.stateProvince: Donegal, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, Limerick, Mayo and Meath

paragraph.materialsCitation: Counties: Donegal, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, Limerick, Mayo and Meath .

subSubSection.paragraph:
·
Scheloribates ( Scheloribates ) pallidulus
(C.L. Koch, 1841)
*

· Original name:
Zetes pallidulus C.L. Koch, 1841
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden , 31(9).

· Historical combinations/variations:
Oribata pallidula (C.L. Koch) Michael, 1898
;
Scheloribates pallidulus (C.L. Koch) Sellnick 1928
.

· Synonyms:
Zetes fuscomaculatus C.L. Koch, 1841
;
Protoribates ( Scheloribates ) frigidus Berlese, 1908
;
Scheloribates ponticus Subbotina, 1989
.
Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Stored food products (O’Farrell and Butler 1948). Counties: Antrim, Derry and Down.

·
Scheloribates ( Scheloribates ) latipes
(C.L. Koch, 1844)

· Original name:
Zetes latipes C.L. Koch, 1844
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden , 38 (14).

· Historical combinations/variations:
Oribates latipes (C.L. Koch) Berlese, 1886
;
Scheloribates latipes (C.L. Koch) Sellnick, 1928
.

· Synonyms:
Oribata clavipectinata Ewing, 1907
;
Scheloribates campestris Mihelčič, 1966
;
Scheloribates grandis Subbotina, 1979
.
Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Grassland and ant nests (Arroyo et al. 2015). Counties: Limerick

·
Scheloribates ( Scheloribates ) saxicola
(Halbert, 1920)
*

· Original name:
Oribatula saxicola Halbert, 1920

· In: The Acarina of seashore. Proceedings of the Royal Irish Academy , 35, 101–152. Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Uunder flakes in the rocky shore and under lichens growing on boulders (Halbert 1920; Evans et al. 1961).
